result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominique M Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
12-01-15/ Judge William S Pocan**
The Court ordered defendant to pay additional restitution in the amount of $1,995.63, to be paid to Bouchards;   $2,164.80 to be paid to Bouchards, for a total amount of $4,160.43.                                        **

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $2,164.80, to be paid to Bouchards.
Additional restitution for wages to be determined. Hearing December 1, 2015

Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the  Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one (1) year Initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment at the probation agent's discretion.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Bouchards and Rami M.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screen.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCE HEARING/RESTITUTION HEARING (ADJOURNED) (53 pages) commencing OCTOBER 29, 2015 received and filed.
Reflects 12-01-15 Court order for $1,995.63 of ADDITIONAL restitution.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Defendant Dominique M Gray in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Additional restitution is ordered as stipulated by parties in the amount of $1995.63 to be paid to Bouchards, for a total amount of $4160.43, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 670
cf

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Defendant Dominique M Gray in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 26.

State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statements by Rami M. and Pierre W.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 15 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Bouchards and Rami M.
*Seek and maintain full time employment at the Probation agents discretion.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $2164.80 to be paid to Bouchards.  Additional restitution for wages to be determined.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.


Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief' Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed on October 12, 2015.

On the same day, at the hour of 11:33  a.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, Derk VM, brought in a verdict as follows:

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Dominique M. Gray, GUILTY of Burglary to a Building or Dwelling, as party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in Count 1 of the Information.  Dated this 14th day of October, 2015.  Derk VM, Foreperson."
.
On direction of the Court, deputy clerk polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed.  Court discharged the jury at 11:37 am.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions and jury questions.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 8:37 am.   Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:43 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies D. Flower and C. Hauski who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury in box at 10:50 am.  Jurors have a question, jurors listened to audio.  Jury out of box at 11:22 am.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:56 pm.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Mark Pollard. Exhibit #2 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 3:18 pm.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 3:45 pm.  Sworn for defense: Dominique Gray, Orma M.  Defense rests.  State and Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence denied by the court.  Jury out of box at 4:16 pm.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 9:48 am.   Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Joshua Seidl.  Exhibit #7 offered and received.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Sargent Elbertroy Jackson.  Exhibit #8 offered and received.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Mark Pollard.  Jury out of box at 10:39 am for break.  Jury in box at 11:24 am.  Exhibit #9 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 11:59.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury panel in court at 2:50 pm.  Voir dire continued.
Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury out of box at 2:51 pm for break.  Jury in box at 3:20 pm.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Rami M. Exhibit #1 offered and received.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Joshua Seidl.  Exhibits #3, 4, 5, 6 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 4:44 pm.  Court recessed for the day.  The Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial on October 13, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:55 am.  Jurors out of box at 11:25 am,  juror #14 remains, requesting to answer voir dire question without presence of other jurors.  Jurors in box at 11:28 am.  Jurors out of box at 11:58 am.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  James C. Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 26.
Defense orally amended the witness list and State handwrote an additional witness to their list.  Case remains in trial posture in br. 26 on October 12, 2015.
Attorney Ann Heaps in court as new counsel to reschedule final pretrial.  Case calendared for October 8, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
Letter from attorney Procaccio regarding representation change received and filed.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Parties discussed issues that are going to need additional time and will not be ready to proceed with jury trial next week.  Court granted jury trial being adjourned as stipulated by parties.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference  and Jury Trial, Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Final pretrial conference.  Court down due to an emergency.   Case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion in Limine filed.
filed.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Final pretrial.  Court in trial.    Case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine filed.
Defense Witness List filed.
State's Witness List filed.
Proposed Jury Instructions filed.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel needs additional to file documents and requests another final pretrial conference.     Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Held off the record. Defense requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for Luch Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Ron Dague for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominique M Gray in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/2/15 @ 1:30 pm
